Articles.Content:
I'm a bit colorblind and I find it hard to read the DeltaV indicator on the GUI. I basically guess when to stop thrust based on the little arrow.

please add colorblind support. thanks.
I'm not colorblind myself, but I have two friends that are. I support this.

I always wondered if the active mode to be green and the inactive to be red in SAS was a problem for colorblind people. Perhaps these color could be addapted as well?

Also: Full support for the original suggestion.
Or maybe just add ability to change the colors of pretty much everything

> 
> I always wondered if the active mode to be green and the inactive to be red in SAS was a problem for colorblind people. Perhaps these color could be addapted as well?
> Also: Full support for the original suggestion.

It's not really a problem due to the contrast of the light state.

Source: Am colorblind.
There is a lot of GUI text that gets lost even for color-capable seers. Basically any text that isn't backed by an opaque window.
Blinking text could help particularly with the dV indicator. The closer to zero the faster it should blink (or vice versa). Perhaps not the text itself, but some character before or after it.

> 
> I always wondered if the active mode to be green and the inactive to be red in SAS was a problem for colorblind people. Perhaps these color could be addapted as well?

Wait - The SAS-off button is red? I'm a bit colorblind myself and couldn't notice this till now, even can't see it now... My whole life is a lie

> 
> Blinking text could help particularly with the dV indicator. The closer to zero the faster it should blink (or vice versa). Perhaps not the text itself, but some character before or after it.

yeah, if someone was able to see whatever "almost-invisible color" is blinking... I don't think you understand how colorblind works.

I agree we need more accessibility options as KSP gets more popular.

This is a very informative read, and I really think Squad should give it a read too.

[Inside the Box: Adding a Colorblind Mode to Borderlands 2](http://www.gearboxsoftware.com/community/articles/1128)
